Header: Court told that Basil Rajapaksa’s wife laid the foundation stone to build the house at Malwana
Content: It was announced in the Gampaha High Court today that Pushpa Rajapaksa, the wife of former Minister Basil Rajapaksa laid the foundation stone for the construction of the house on his Malwana land. This announcement was made when the related case was taken up for hearing today. The case filed by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division under the allegation of building a house on a land purchased in the Malwana area misusing a sum of 207 million rupees of state funds was taken up for hearing in the Gampaha High Court today in the presence of High Court Judge Nimal Ranaweera. Chartered Architect Muditha Jayakody gave evidence in the case. He said that it was Basil Rajapaksa’s wife Pushpa Rajapaksa who laid the foundation stone on the land for the construction of the house. Meanwhile the Court granted permission to Basil Rajapaksa to travel abroad from the 10th of this month to the 03rd of October. It was in response to a request made from the Court to seek medical treatment.
